boardgame.name: Abenteuer aus der Gruft II
boardgame.description:
From the backcover:

Das Erscheinen der legendären "Deutschland-Box" im Jahre 2003 setzte neue Maßstäbe für die Rollenspielwelt. Und während der Quellenteil seit 2011 in Buchform bzw. digital erhältlich ist, warteten die Fans vergeblich auf eine Neuauflage der meisten in der Box enthaltenen Abenteuer. Bis heute. Denn hiermit treten zurück ins Rampenlicht:

Finstere Glut

Sucht nach Leben

& 10 Kurzabenteuer

boardgame.name: Das Bankett: Teil 1 – Der Raub des Diamanten von Ramanpur
boardgame.description:
This a cooperative detective story!
From the beginning of the game you get all information (newspaper, interviews, links to websites etc.) and then you have to solve the case!

The golden wedding of the Countess von Donnerswarth was to be an epoch-making event. A remote, noble hotel, exquisite guests and, to top it off, a banquet at which the countess would display her husband's gift: the legendary Ramanpur diamond. But that same night the precious gem inexplicably disappears from your hotel safe.
Who among the guests knew the safe combination? Who had access to the crime scene? Who has usurped the gemstone unnoticed?

Find the decisive clues in this circumstantial case and convict the thief or the thief of the diamond of Ramanpur.

This game can be played independently of "Das Bankett - Teil 2"
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Das Bankett: Teil 2 – Der Fluch des Diamanten von Ramanpur

boardgame.name: Das Bankett: Teil 2 – Der Fluch des Diamanten von Ramanpur
boardgame.description:
This a cooperative detective story!
From the beginning of the game you get all information (newspaper, interviews, links to websites etc.) and then you have to solve the case!

Although the robbery of the Ramanpur diamond was cleared up after the banquet, some puzzles remain unsolved. An illness afflicts the kitchen staff, an inexplicable red fog covers the hotel grounds and finally the von Schwarzburg twins have to undergo psychiatric treatment after they have mysteriously disappeared.
Are these events related to the curse of the diamond?

According to legend, the diamond curses anyone who gets hold of it. Uncover if there are indeed higher forces at work here or if there is a logical explanation for all events.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Das Bankett: Teil 1 – Der Raub des Diamanten von Ramanpur

boardgame.name: Auksinis protas: Startas Nr. 1
boardgame.description:
The game consists of 100 cards with 200 questions, an answer book and 10 joker cards, of which the TV game hosts - Arūnas Valinskas and Andrius Tapinas - will give the players fun QR tasks. You can compete one on one or form teams and embark on a real intelligence fight.
The game begins with the first round of cards (1 to 50 cards and with 5 joker cards) to be shuffled and folded on the table. Cards are drawn in turn, questions are read aloud. If the game is a team based, team members can consult with each other. Answers are checked by the opponent or the opposing team. After playing the first round, the second is played on the same principle (from 51 to 100 cards and with 5 joker cards).
1 point is awarded for the correct answer. For proper performance of the joker's task - 3 points. For transferring a joker card to another player (or team) without reading the QR code - 0 points. After scanning the QR code of a missed task, 1 point is deducted. The participant or team with the most points wins.

The cards can be used as a stand-alone game or as an expansion for "Golden Mind: a great board game". Also, this game can be expanded with "Golden Mind. Start No. 2" cards.


Žaidimą sudaro 100 kortelių su 200 klausimų, atsakymų knygelė ir 10 džokerio kortelių, nuo kurių nuskaičius QR smagias užduotis žaidėjams pateiks patys TV žaidėjų vedėjai - Arūnas Valinskas ir Andrius Tapinas. Galite rungtis vienas prieš vieną arba sudaryti komandas ir leistis į tikriausią intelekto kovą.
Žaidimas pradedamas pirmojo turo kortelėmis (nuo 1 iki 50 kortelės ir su 5 džokerio kortelėmis), kurias reikia sumaišyti ir užverstas padėti ant stalo. Kortelės traukiamos paeiliui, klausimai skaitomi garsiai. Jei žaidimas komandinis, komandos nariai gali tartis tarpusavyje. Atsakymus tikrina priešininkas arba priešininkų komanda. Sužaidus pirmąjį turą, tokiu pat principu žaidžiamas antrasis (nuo 51 iki 100 kortelės ir su 5 džokerio kortelėmis).
Už teisingą atsakymą skiriamas 1 taškas. Už tinkamą džokerio užduoties atlikimą – 3 taškai. Už džokerio kortelės perleidimą kitam žaidėjui (ar komandai) nenuskaičius QR kodo – 0 taškų. Už neatliktą užduotį nuskaičius QR kodą atimamas 1 taškas. Laimi daugiausia taškų surinkęs dalyvis arba komanda.

Kortelės gali būti naudojamos kaip atskiras žaidimas arba papildyti žaidimą „Auksinis protas: Didysis stalo žaidimas". Taip pat, šį žaidimą galima praplėsti su "Auksinis protas. Startas Nr. 2" kortomis.

boardgame.name: Der Fluch des Waldes II (fan expansion for The Adventures of Robin Hood)
boardgame.description:
With this adventure booklet you can experience another exciting adventure of Robin Hood and his companions. It plays around the same time as chapter 4. The story of the adventure plays independently of the others and therefore no prior knowledge of other chapters is necessary.

Since new elements and tiles from later adventures have been added, it is recommended that you have already played the basic game. All outlaws already have their own special abilities. The functions for new items can be found on the following page. No prior knowledge of this adventure is required.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Der Fluch des Waldes III (fan expansion for The Adventures of Robin Hood)
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Folk Tales & Fairy Tales: Robin Hood
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Der Fluch des Waldes (fan expansion for The Adventures of Robin Hood)

boardgame.name: Rafty Ride
boardgame.description:
You wake up on a desolate island, your clothes are soaked & the last thing you remember is looking out your ships’ deck as a storm tossed it about in the ocean. Far to the east of the island, you see your cargo of colourful rafts gently nudging the shore. The adventurer in you awakens!

On your turn each player gets 3 actions: Dice Roll, Path Bending and Movement. Based on the colours rolled on the first action the player can choose rafts for the next action where they place and remove rafts from anyones path. The player can either move free to a raft of the same colour or roll a Draft to move to a raft of another colour. Attack other players by rolling any colour doubles and skip a raft on double draft.

Create your own path by building, breaking & jumping across the colourful rafts to make your way back to the Shore. The first player to reach shore wins the game!

Roll the dice to test your luck in this sweet and brutal game.

boardgame.name: Pagan: Beyond the Palisades
Pagan: Jenseits der Palisade
boardgame.description:
Pagan: Beyond the Palisades is the first expansion for Pagan: Fate of Roanoke.

Pagan is an asymmetrical card game for two players taking on the roles of Witch or Witch hunter. The Witch tries to carry out a ritual of renaturation before being exposed and eliminated by the Witch hunter. Nine villagers are under suspicion and only the Witch player knows who the real Witch is. Each turn, the players use their action pawns on active villagers to draw cards, play cards, gain influence and manage the Gloom. Moreover, the Witch can brew powerful potions, improve their familiar and cast enchantments and charms, while the Witch hunter enlists allies, claim strategic locations, and ruthlessly investigates the villagers.

Beyond the Palisades introduces two new mechanics to Pagan: Gloom and Cleanse.
Gloom is a new resource that benefits the Witch player as long as it is in play. It symbolizes the Witch's symbiotic
relationship with the lands. Gloom enters the game through the play of Gloom-cards and can be reduced or increased
during a game. Some cards can even break the natural limits of the Gloom on the cards.
With sufficient effort and focus, it is possible to cleanse the Gloom encroaching on the village. Cleansing a card is done
by removing every last bit of Gloom. Once a card is cleansed it is discarded.

Content
The game features 4 scenarios, 9 all new villagers, 30 Gloom tokens and 2 full pre-made decks for each player (50 cards each).

boardgame.name: Smarter than a Monkey
boardgame.description:
A quiz game for the whole family where the question goes to the one who bets the highest! All questions are written in a manner where you have 4 alternatives that are true or false. A Monkey would on average get 2 right. So you need to have 3 out of 4 to be Smarter than a Monkey.

The questions are revealed in parts and you bet bananas to gain the right to answer the question. If your answer is correct you win the bananas. Most bananas in the end wins! The base game can be expanded with question expansions. Along with this first version, one expansion will be made available: Smarter than a Monkey - The Solar System.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Smarter than a Monkey: Solar System

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: KrimiGames Case 1: La Famiglia
boardgame.description:
This a cooperative detective story!
From the beginning of the game you get all information (newspaper, interviews, links to websites etc.) and then you have to solve the case!

The Carabinieri of Catanzaro need your help: The notorious Tegano Mafia family controls the city and the entire province. But with the death of the eldest son, there is a unique opportunity to put an end to their trade forever.

In this puzzle game, you will receive a case file with evidence, documents and all kinds of clues. Analyze bills, parking tickets, newspaper articles, autopsy reports and much more in order to convict the perpetrator. Use tools like social media profiles and websites to identify motives and check alibis.

Can you solve the case?

- Case files based on real criminal cases
- Interactive elements
- Use other exciting sources such as the Internet
- Put your analytical skills to the test
- Work with your friends

boardgame.name: Pocket Escape: Der Schneediamant
boardgame.description:
Ready to use anytime, anywhere: The Escape Game puzzle booklet!

There is no question that Miyu Moto, it girl and undercover specialist from the Dyscover detective agency, has to be seen at the penthouse party in the Holden Tower. It's the high society event of the year. But the guests are behaving strangely every minute. Is the new party drug snow diamond to blame? And who distributes the drug among the celebrants? Then Miyu discovers someone in the crowd that she would never have expected at this party ...

28 pages full of puzzles and difficult decisions are waiting for you. Pocket Escape: The snow diamond fits in every pocket - the ideal case for at home or your luggage!

boardgame.name: Auksinis protas: Startas Nr. 2
boardgame.description:
The game consists of 100 cards with 200 questions, an answer book and 10 joker cards, of which the TV game hosts - Arūnas Valinskas and Andrius Tapinas - will give the players fun QR tasks. You can compete one on one or form teams and embark on a real intelligence fight.
The game begins with the first round of cards (101 to 150 cards and with 5 joker cards) to be shuffled and folded on the table. Cards are drawn in turn, questions are read aloud. If the game is a team based, team members can consult with each other. Answers are checked by the opponent or the opposing team. After playing the first round, the second is played on the same principle (from 151 to 200 cards and with 5 joker cards).
1 point is awarded for the correct answer. For proper performance of the joker's task - 3 points. For transferring a joker card to another player (or team) without reading the QR code - 0 points. After scanning the QR code of a missed task, 1 point is deducted. The participant or team with the most points wins.

The cards can be used as a stand-alone game or as an expansion for "Golden Mind: a great board game". Also, this game can be expanded with "Golden Mind. Start No. 1" cards.


Žaidimą sudaro 100 kortelių su 200 klausimų, atsakymų knygelė ir 10 džokerio kortelių, nuo kurių nuskaičius QR smagias užduotis žaidėjams pateiks patys TV žaidėjų vedėjai - Arūnas Valinskas ir Andrius Tapinas. Galite rungtis vienas prieš vieną arba sudaryti komandas ir leistis į tikriausią intelekto kovą.
Žaidimas pradedamas pirmojo turo kortelėmis (nuo 101 iki 150 kortelės ir su 5 džokerio kortelėmis), kurias reikia sumaišyti ir užverstas padėti ant stalo. Kortelės traukiamos paeiliui, klausimai skaitomi garsiai. Jei žaidimas komandinis, komandos nariai gali tartis tarpusavyje. Atsakymus tikrina priešininkas arba priešininkų komanda. Sužaidus pirmąjį turą, tokiu pat principu žaidžiamas antrasis (nuo 151 iki 200 kortelės ir su 5 džokerio kortelėmis).
Už teisingą atsakymą skiriamas 1 taškas. Už tinkamą džokerio užduoties atlikimą – 3 taškai. Už džokerio kortelės perleidimą kitam žaidėjui (ar komandai) nenuskaičius QR kodo – 0 taškų. Už neatliktą užduotį nuskaičius QR kodą atimamas 1 taškas. Laimi daugiausia taškų surinkęs dalyvis arba komanda.

Kortelės gali būti naudojamos kaip atskiras žaidimas arba papildyti žaidimą „Auksinis protas: Didysis stalo žaidimas". Taip pat, šį žaidimą galima praplėsti su "Auksinis protas. Startas Nr. 1" kortomis.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Kriminalkuvert: Ein schweres Erbe
boardgame.description:
This a cooperative detective story!
From the beginning of the game you get all information (newspaper, interviews, links to websites etc.) and then you have to solve the case!

Your great-great-uncle, whom you never knew consciously, gave you an inheritance in his will.

You are already excited to see what to expect when only this envelope arrives.

The initial disappointment with the supposedly useless inheritance quickly turns into keen interest when you discover that your relative, a police officer by profession, has left you documents on a criminal case that he apparently worked on unofficially in his spare time.

And with whom he personally had more to do than he should ...

You can buy it here:
https://www.ergoetzlichkeit-shop.com/

boardgame.name: Kriminalkuvert: Todesspiel
boardgame.description:
This a cooperative detective story!
From the beginning of the game you get all information (newspaper, interviews, links to websites etc.) and then you have to solve the case!

It should have been a happy and conciliatory card game: Six people meet on an island in the tranquil Bad Leckersmoor to spend a sociable evening together. But in the end one of them is dead.

Those present are all valued members of the community: some work on the local council, some are important industrialists.

The law firm entrusted with the estate of the deceased senses inconsistencies and asks you for help.

boardgame.name: Surviving and Fighting in the Jungle
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A trip in the jungle? Getting stranded on a tropical island? Searching for treasures in long lost ruins?
What are the dangers to be faced in these situations? How to survive in rainforest?

This PDF provides both DM and players with a lot of small rules to better flesh out the experience of surviving in a lush, yet very dangerous place like the jungle.

Flora and fauna, terrain dangers, climate, diseases and insects, finding food, three new vegetable monsters, and a couple tables containing useful equipment, services and transport means for missions in rainforests!

boardgame.name: Monster Hunters on Main Street
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Get up and running with your monster hunting and occult investigations with this supplement for Diogo Nogueira's Dark Streets & Darker Secrets! Originally part of an older version of Moonlight on Roseville Beach, these life paths help generate connected characters who know each other and include three variant archetypes: the jock, the werewolf, and the wereraven, as well as rules for the lycanthropy power.

boardgame.name: Dark Designs in Verdigris
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

It found the Wizard and brought him here, found Dorothy and brought her along, too. You did not plan for Oz to take you, but then there were cyclones, angry mobs, gunfire, storms at sea, holes in the world you thought would bury you. And then you flew, and you belonged to Oz. Your monochrome life was over for good.

Queen Ozma reigned with her consort Dorothy by her side. The Emerald City gleamed with color and sunlight, and you found a home. You had adventures. You learned a little witchcraft. You had people to love like a family.

But Ozma vanished, Dorothy fled, and Oz fell. The green and glistening ruins are all that remain of The Emerald City, and the lands surrounding it have become The Wastes. Now you live in Verdigris, the cavernous, sunless capital of Oz Below.

Dark Designs in Verdigris is a game about what's left of the Emerald City, long after Oz fell. It first appeared in Codex Emerald in 2019, and got a follow-up piece in Codex Childhood later that year. The game is a single-move PbtA system inspired by World of Dungeons and Offworlders.

boardgame.name: Rookery: Winter Travels, Woodland Roads
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Troika! Backgrounds for Travelers Strange and Mundane: The Rookery Zine Issue 2

In this second issue of the R. Rook Studio zine:


Strange people wandering along cold, woodland roads at night: a lost squire, a singer, a young adventurer wielded by the blade they carry, a penitent, a newly minted oracle, a mortal fury.
Those from other worlds who are trapped on our escaping to a mortal reality: the errant devil, the fallen celestial, a returned changeling, a werewolf.

boardgame.name: Rookery: Classes of Magic
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

OSR Classes for D&D BX & Optional Magic Rules: The Rookery Zine Issue 1

In this inaugural issue of the R. Rook Studio zine:


Seven new OSR classes for the D&D;s 1981 Basic/Expert edition (B/X) and similar games like Old School Essentials or Labyrinth Lord, adapted from R. Rook's Barrow Keep setting. Including: The Beast Bound, The Imp, The Seer, and shapeshifting The Wolf Marked.
Modular rules for magical rituals, with sample rituals for divination, protection, and oaths. Designed for old-school and retro games, they can adapt to a variety of systems, likewise adapted from Barrow Keep.

boardgame.name: Freebooting Rogues of the Infinite Void
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

36 Backgrounds for Fantastic Spacefaring Adventure (Compatible with Troika!)

Miss those 90s-era days of spacefaring Advanced Dungeoneering (with maybe some Dragons)?

Find 'em again with this handy book of 36 Extra Classic Space Fantasy backgrounds. Join in for privateering, exploration, arachnodemon resistance, and horrific terrors made out of clockwork.

Ogres, gnomes, werewizards, vampires, constructs, and alchemists ALL included with purchase.

boardgame.name: Japanese: The Game – Fantasy Expansion
boardgame.description:
This 36-card Fantasy Expansion Deck brings you vocabulary appropriate to the fantasy realm. Words like “Dragon,” “Magic,” “Treasure,” “Fight,” “Steal,” and “Cast a Spell” are included along with a mix of particles and other words that allow these cards to integrate into a Core Deck without any loss of play balance.

Each expansion to Japanese: The Game adds new vocabulary words, and thus the rules that go along with how each noun, verb, or particle can be placed to make a sentence.

The expansion decks are shuffled in with the main deck to accommodate more players (the game plays 2 by itself and needs either an additional core deck or an expansion to accommodate more), or just to add less common words to the mix for 1-2 players.

boardgame.name: Japanese: The Game – Slang Expansion
boardgame.description:
This 36-card Slang Expansion Deck brings you vocabulary that is used in a less formal setting. Words like “Cool,” “Hey,” “Gross,” “Lame,” and “Iffy” are included along with a mix of particles and other words and phrases that allow these cards to integrate into a Core Deck without any loss of play balance.

Each expansion to Japanese: The Game adds new vocabulary words, and thus the rules that go along with how each noun, verb, or particle can be placed to make a sentence.

The expansion decks are shuffled in with the main deck to accommodate more players (the game plays 2 by itself and needs either an additional core deck or an expansion to accommodate more), or just to add less common words to the mix for 1-2 players.

boardgame.name: Japanese: The Game – Blank Expansion
boardgame.description:
This 36-card Blank Expansion Deck brings you blank cards that will allow you to create your cards to integrate with the Core decks. The cards a colored by word type such as “Noun,” “Verb,” “Adjective,” "Adverb," and “Participle” as well as plenty of space to write the Kanji character, description, and example sentence in Japanese. Once all the blank fields have been completed, the cards can be integrated into a Core Deck. There are also 2 cards outlining the Godan Conjugation Table for reference.

This expansion to Japanese: The Game gives you the opportunity to customize your learning experience by adding new vocabulary words that are more specific to your personal needs.

The expansion decks are shuffled in with the main deck to accommodate more players (the game plays 2 by itself and needs either an additional core deck or an expansion to accommodate more), or just to add less common words to the mix for 1-2 players.

boardgame.name: The Heroes' Ball
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A one-page Halloween special that is completely system-neutral. This short adventure is sure to test the group's social and investigative skills.

A social gathering at the mansion of the party's old friend/mentor takes a bizarre turn when their host expresses highly inappropriate desires. Will the party see through his lies and walk away with their lives?

Warning: features themes of suicide and mental illness which may be inappropriate for some players.

boardgame.name: Longfish
boardgame.description:
Longfish is a children's fish building card game with the goal of creating the longest fish! Elements of memory and push-your-luck to find and build the longest fish.

From a grid, flip over one card at a time to build a complete fish, a complete fish must have one head and one tail and may have two additional middle-body parts. Once a fish is complete you can either take the cards or keep flipping cards to add body parts (push your luck style). If a non-matching fish part is flipped, return all flipped cards face-down (memory style).

Game ends when all 12 fish have been built.
The winner is the one with the most cards.

The game includes 36 playing cards and 4 rule cards.

Longfish can be played in 3 different modes: match, build, and fish.

boardgame.name: Crux
boardgame.description: Created from a love of both climbing and card games, Crux is a simple yet strategic game to play. The concept is to draw cards to complete your problem while preventing your opponents from doing the same.

boardgame.name: Phinny in a Jam
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Spooky Refrigerator Themed Game Jam Submission

Strange Scenario Hook - Derelict shuttle
Funny NPC - Phinneas 0'Spuddles
Creepy Symbiant creature - Furrbil
Gross item - Würm Jam

boardgame.name: D20 Spoiled Spoils & Mold Monsters
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Everyone in the 'verse needs to eat and if your Legionnaires have found a rusted out unplugged fridge, here are some goodies to reward them with! The d20 table will allow your Legionnaires to sift through the detritus within the fridge in search of anything edible or useful. Unfortunately for them, the mold is animate and waiting in ambush! Five items on the d20 list are upgraded Mold Monsters to challenge the Legionnaires' search for loot.

boardgame.name: The Riverchase
boardgame.description: A "micro" scenario for The World of Esaene with Goblins stealing boats from Dwarves. PCs may play as either faction or even just opportunistic adventurers.

boardgame.name: ¡Tierra a la Vista!
boardgame.description:
Tierra a la Vista is a cooperative game for 2 to 4 players and 40 minute games, where we will become treasure hunters, crew members of a drifting ship trying to return to the mainland with their coffers as full as possible.

The game consists of 2 phases. A planning phase where players will move their characters around the ship collecting action points in the cannons, sails, spyglass, among others, that they will have to collect and then use in the exploration phase.

In the exploration phase, players will take turns drawing cards from the exploration decks trying to get treasures, avoid the weather and defeat the pirates, while they are running out of supplies and the ship suffers damage that will have to be repaired if they do not want to sink. All this using their action points in the best possible way.

The objective is to find in the depths of each deck the three map fragments that will take them back home.
You will win the game if you succeed, and if you have the required amount of treasure in your coffers. But if a crew member drowns, they run out of supplies, or the ship sinks, they will have failed, and their ship will be one more lost in the depths of the sea.

It will not be an easy task. Only cooperation, coordination and teamwork will bring you back.

Beware of Pirates!

The prototype of this game was awarded the "Best New Latin Game" award in the Quarantine Challenge 2020 organized by the game makers community in Mexico.

boardgame.name: Dragons of Legend and Wyrms of Folklore
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

British mythology is full of famous dragonslayers, from Beowulf to Saint George. Dragons usually appear in the larger folklore of England, Wales, and Scotland with stories which link them with fixed locations and legends throughout the UK. As such, a large portion of Britain’s dragons are part of local folktales that have been handed down over centuries.

This short product is a (growing) collection of a few of these legends, with stats for RPGs using OSR rules. They fit medieval-authentic games specially well.

Here you'll find:

The rules we use to create base stats for monsters in OSR games (not just dragons)
Five local legends of dragons from various parts of the British Islands, with stats for the relevant creatures and items.

boardgame.name: Fabula Ultima
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:
FABULA ULTIMA è il Gioco di Ruolo da tavolo ispirato ai JRPG, i videogiochi di ruolo alla giapponese, in cui si narrano epiche storie di aspiranti eroi e temibili cattivi, ambientate in mondi fantastici traboccanti di magia, pieni di misteri e luoghi meravigliosi da scoprire e abitati da mostri unici e bizzarri!

English translation:
FABULA ULTIMA is the tabletop RPG inspired by JRPG, the Japanese-style role-playing video games, in which epic stories of aspiring heroes and fearsome villains are told, set in fantastic worlds full of magic, mysteries and wonderful places to discover and inhabited by unique and bizarre monsters!

boardgame.name: Darkness Gather Under the Great Silver Hall
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

An Underdark adventure. Investigate a dwarven mine stronghold under the Monkrath Mountains. Can be placed into any mountainous region or mine setting. Ch. 1 of “The Dark Below” adventure path. Can be played as kickoff for larger adventure settings or a one-shot adventure for your players.

This is the first in a two-part adventure working with Monster Brew DM (Jamie Brannan). His unique encounter design really shines in this Underdark adventure for three to fix adventurers of 3rd or 4th level. If you like the Underdark adventures, this series has what you want.

King Bderg Giantsmasher and his clan built their mine stronghold under Monkrath Mountains some 200 years ago. They drove out monsters that dwelt within the caves under the mountain and for their efforts were rewarded a steady stream of silver to mine. Naming the mine, Eth Stjora Zilvren Helgot.

However, what they had not told anyone was that the monsters were at the command of drow. These dark masters had sought to use the creatures as a way to clear a path for an advancing drow army. They sought to wreak havoc on an unsuspecting surface world.

Clan Giansmasher fought the enemy back into the depth of the caves. Bderg cut down the leader of the drow Agthar’Yaz-inyon casting them into the darkness below before ordering the passage sealed shut, cutting the drow off from the surface. Or so they thought.

boardgame.name: Meeple Company
boardgame.description:
Meeple Company is a strategic worker placement boardgame in which you will have to play your meeples wisely to accomplish your company's three objectives.

You will be able to choose between four types of companies: the laboratory, the toy factory, the robotics company and the chocolate factory. The objectives to be achieved will be the following:

To have a single meeple of your presidency.
To have the highest number of meeples in your main department
To have no prohibited meeples in your company.

To achieve this, you will be able to perform 4 different actions:

Hire: you choose a meeple from those located in the center of the table and place it in your Hall.
Move: you choose one of your meeples and send it to a rival's Hall.
Send to a Congress: you choose a meeple from your work area or from the center of the table and everyone must remove a meeple of that color from their company.
Close: you close your company for this day, you will not be able to perform any more actions or receive any more meeple. The meeples of your Hall go to your work area.

boardgame.name: Sixteen Stars
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Immerse yourself as crew members investigating the horrific events of the asteroid mining outpost Zodiac 7 in this unique dice bag building roleplaying game.

The central mechanism of SIXTEEN STARS is it's dice bag which is use to bring the in game tension to real life. Do you draw more dice from the bag, increasing your odds of success while also increasing your risk of creating noise and drawing the attention of the unfathomable?

Designed for easy to pick up and play in the same night for one-shot session action.

boardgame.name: Grindhouse!
boardgame.description:
Grindhouse! is a beautifully weird card game for two to four players set in the world of seventies B-movies. By collecting and playing production cards with the requisite values for the genre you're aiming for—and whatever review you're aiming to get—you complete a production and rake in bucks at the box office. Earn more money than your competition and you win the game!

Players collect and play Production Cards onto productions, in separate horizontal rows on the table in front of them, and can work on up to two at a time. There are four different "roles" for Production Cards: Directors (yellow), Actors (blue), On Set (red), and Post (green). Each card has a numeric cost indicating how many cards you must discard to play it on a production and most have one or more value symbols: afros, blood, boobs, buildings, explosions, fists, wheels, and reels.

A production that contains all four roles can be wrapped (completed) by playing a Genre Card and Review Card onto it. Both cards show a value cost—met or exceeded with the value symbols on the Production Cards—and a box office haul for your completed film.

Once a player has wrapped two productions (three in a two-player game), the game ends and box office receipts are totaled and the highest score wins.

boardgame.name: LUNA Capital: Promo 1 – Special Sponsor Tiles
boardgame.description:
This Promo contains four new Sponsor Tiles for LUNA Capital.: Royal Space Cruise, Astro Burger, Luna Taxis, Moon PAradise Real Estate.

The companies investing in the LUNA Capital project are hard hitters at the top of the game and are willing to do anything to take home the prize.

If you decide to use these Special Sponsor tiles, then at the beginning of the game you will take the Sponsor cards, place them face down, and mix them up. After shuffling them, distribute them randomly to the players and each takes the matching Special Sponsor tile. Each player must put their Sponsor tile on their Sponsor card. To activate these tiles, when the player chooses a Delivery, they may immediately discard one of the Project tiles they just acquired to immediately use their Special Sponsor tile.

The new special sponsor tiles are:

Moon Paradise Real Estate: This tile is placed on the table next to a Building Site on one of the player’s cards that has already been placed (thereby “enlarging” the settlement). Later, the player may place any Project tile on top of it as though it were an empty site. However, it cannot be moved and no Construction card can be placed on top of it. It does not affect any of the restrictions regarding the placement of cards.

LUNA Taxis: When a player places this tile in their Settlement, they may move one of the Project tiles they have already placed to any other empty site in their Settlement, in accordance with the standard placement rules.

Astroburger: When a player places this tile in their Settlement, they may reserve one of the Project tiles that they have taken this turn by putting it on their Sponsor card. They may then place that tile in their Settlement during any subsequent turn, after choosing their Delivery.

Space Royal Cruise: When a player places this tile in their Settlement, they may choose a Construction card in one of the 4 Deliveries and place it at the bottom of the deck. Replace the removed card with the top card from the deck.

boardgame.name: Bitoku: Essen 2021 Gate Tiles Promo
boardgame.description: Two new Gate tiles for Bitoku included in the first printrun of the game sold during SPIEL 2021.

boardgame.name: Pebble Witch
boardgame.description: Play as a witch. Talk to pebbles. Sit. Reflect on the melancholy of becoming.
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2021 AGD Awards Best Emerging Game Nominee

boardgame.name: Video World
boardgame.description: ideo World is a Halloween synth-pop musical about working at a video store.
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2021 AGD Awards Best Emerging Game Winner

boardgame.name: Streets of My Town
boardgame.description: Streets of My Town connects young people with support services in their local community. Through interactive storytelling in a gorgeous hand-painted world players discover the solutions to common youth issues.
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2021 AGD Awards Best Serious Game of the Year Nominee

boardgame.name: Warrior Heroes: To Be King
boardgame.description:
A KINGDOM IS YOURS FOR THE TAKING!

Includes color counters and Battle Boards
Your troops are tired and slowly giving ground. They've fought hard all day against an infinite number of enemy troops. They've done all that you've asked of them and more. They've covered themselves with both blood and glory and look to you for victory.

The fate of your nation hangs in the balance as you desperately search for that one spot to launch your final attack. There! Gathering your personal horsemen, you draw your sword for it is now or never. The battle rests on your strong right arm.

Warrior Heroes – To Be King! is set in the mythical world of Talomir and is compatible with our Fantasy RPG, Warrior Heroes – Adventures in Talomir. Talomir is a land where dozens of Nations vie for dominance and like other games, we've provided you with Army Lists that describe your troops and how to assemble them for Battle. Other games allow for fighting individual Battles, but we've taken it farther, much farther.

We’ve added a simple to use, fast play Campaign System that ties all your Battles together to insure that every Battle means something. With the Warrior Heroes – To Be King! Campaign System, you are the Commander of the Army one minute and the King, or Queen, the next.

And best of all; you can play solo, cooperatively against the game, or competitively, head to head.
Do you have what it takes to be King?

–Description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: 1821: Journey to Freedom
boardgame.description:
1821: Journey to Freedom is a fast-paced game in which each player takes on the role of a companion of Kolokotronis, the legendary old man of Morias, on a journey through time, starting with the creation of the Filiki Etereia and ending with the birth of the New Greek state!

The game takes place during the Revolution.
All the players go through cities and villages, participating in the important historical events that played a key role in the struggle for Freedom.

In the Greece of 1821, based on the memoirs of the Old Man of Moria, we pass through cities, castles and villages, fields of critical battles and political decisions, captures of fighters and places of self-sacrifice and martyrdom, on a journey where memory becomes destination, and destination is experience.

The game takes place in the Peloponnese, the central theater of the Revolution. Each player chooses one of four characters from that period. The choice of character also determines the way the player moves in the game. The Member of the Filiki Eteria, the Philhellene, the Woman of the Revolution and the Revolutionary Fighter of 1821 move inside the board, in order to overcome the obstacles in front of them, to gather supplies and finally to lead to the creation of the Greek Nation.

–Description from the publisher

boardgame.name: A Waste of Good Blood
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

This book contains:

New groups, factions, and types of Thin bloods, including Alchemy formulae and techniques, as well as a new strain — the Reavers
An exploration of Caitiff and Panders, and the groups they form for protection
A close look at the Revenant families, including rules and loresheets for using them
Rules and details for playing Dhampirs
New Predator Types, Amalgams, merits & flaws
Loresheets made specifically for Thin bloods and Caitiff

boardgame.name: Forbidden Religions
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Forbidden Religions includes:


A wide selection of belief systems, some widespread and cloaked in secrecy, others extreme in their focus, from Golconda-seekers and Gehenna cults to infernal religions and churches dedicated to methuselahs.
New powers, rituals, and coterie types befitting these religions.
New optional Loresheets, Merits, and Flaws, for use at character creation or to build into your characters as they gain experience.

boardgame.name: Noches de Calahorra
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

This book contains:

An entire city, populated entirely by thin bloods
Details on the history of Calahorra - the smallest city in Spain - both mortal and kindred
A guide to their leadership structure, its rulers, and a selection of the city's residents
Story hooks to pull your characters into the plots and schemes of the citizens
An introductory story, set during the Roman fiesta of Caluguritanna
New systems and a Loresheet, unique to the city

boardgame.name: Powerslaves: A Tome of Sorcery
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

This book contains:

A look at the many undead sorcerers
A discussion on sorcery in game
A comprehensive update of the many sorcerous paths
Rules for Koldunism, Setite Sorcery, and infernal magic
Example SPCs for your chronicle
Loresheets for all types of sorcerers

boardgame.name: The Long Hard Road Out of Hell
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Morality has been a central concept to Vampire the Masquerade from the very first edition. Throughout its history there have been many alternative belief systems that players have experimented with; from Roads and Paths, to the newer concepts of Convictions and Touchstones.

boardgame.name: The Sword of Caine
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

The Sword of Caine has often been viewed by the Camarilla as monstrous beasts that live only to diablerize and destroy. Like all good antagonists, there is another side to the Sabbat. While they harbor murderers and diablerists of all types, they are, at their core, a spiritual sect on a Holy War against ancient beings of terrible power and unfathomable agendas.

In this book, the Sabbat are laid bare. From a breakdown of the sect’s history and hierarchy to their current state as a lean, honed weapon against the tools of the ancients, everything you need to play Sabbat in Vampire: the Masquerade 5th Edition is here.

It’s time you joined the War.

boardgame.name: Uncanny: A Sleepaway Expansion
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

An Expansion to Sleepaway - The Award-Winning Roleplaying Game

"With Sleepaway, Dragon takes the social mechanics of setting elements from Belonging Outside Belonging games, and eases them deftly into the setting—and into the land itself. It's a syncretic wedding between the natural world, the people who tend it, and the supernatural forces that inhabit it."

— Caro Asercion

boardgame.name: Courier: A Solo Adventure RPG
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to the New North America, Courier. People around here call it the “Wasteland” - a barren land full of inhospitable nature, people and wildlife and don’t get me started on the strange anomalous activities popping up! Seems that everything is out to make life hard for those trying to make something from what little is left.

So, that’s why you’re here. You get things where they need to be. A hardy survivor willing to deliver across the vast Wasteland expanses and brave the unknown. We need you to deliver something and are willing to pay top dollar to do so! So what do you say…

Willing to take the job, Courier?

boardgame.name: Dancing at Her Funeral
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You have somehow secured an invitation to the most prestigious event of the season, the funeral of the fairy Distant Song. Foul play is suspected, but in the domain of Joquiet, it doesn’t matter whodunit, as long as it was done with style.

A Four-Hour Adventure for Tier 1 Characters. Optimized for APL 3.

Created as part of the Adventurer's League Dungeon Craft program. The First Adventure taking place in the original Domain of Joquiet.

CONTENT WARNING: Name dysphoria, soap opera twists, murder, funerals, faking death
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-WBW Dungeoncraft, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

boardgame.name: Sugar Rush
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Jean Luc Bailey, a feylost human from the Sword Coast, has stumbled across the domain of Harvest, a fey realm run by an Autumn Eladrin who has ever maintained the balance between summer and winter in her land. Her domain made him long for the Liar's Nights of his childhood and he introduced the holiday to Harvest. Feeling this holiday was tailor-made for them, the residents became obsessed, especially with the candy, and began to celebrate it without ceasing. When Jean Luc was unable to produce any more candy, he was labeled a Cheat, and imprisoned.

One who owes him a debt is engaging the services of the party (by the most fey means possible) to venture into Harvest and make an attempt to free him.

This fun filled 4-hour adventure for Tier 1 characters features seasonal fun and thematic monsters. The optional Costume Party scene provides opportunities to dress up characters and play mini games for prizes. And securing Jean Luc's freedom is no matter of brute force; it'll take the skills of a whole party to pull off!
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-WBW Dungeoncraft, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

boardgame.name: Judge and Jury
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Town Speaker Nimsy Huddle knows Lonelywood better than anyone. So she knows its residents haven’t quite been themselves since the rescue mission. Sure, those broken and battered adventurers brought the missing children back...but something followed them. Now she needs someone she can trust to find out exactly what is going on.

A Two- to Four-Hour Adventure for Tier 2 Characters. Optimized for APL 8.

DC Adventure Seed: Out of the Woods

The second installment in the three-part series Cold and Lonelywood. This adventure is a challenging stand-alone investigation or supplement for your Icewind Dale: Rime of the Frostmaiden and Season 10 Plague of Ancients games. This adventure is legal for Adventurers League play.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures

boardgame.name: The Amber Dirge
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Your benefactor, Alanik Ray, has dispatched you to Har’Akir to investigate rumors of the White Oasis. Residents of the nearby River’s Shelter are all dying and seek to cleanse themselves in the oasis’s waters as hauntingly beautiful reed pipe music accompanies their passing. Something isn’t quite right, however. Are there more nefarious deeds afoot?

The forth in the Ravenloft: Mist Hunters series of adventures.

An adventure for 4th-level characters.

boardgame.name: Annalyse's Revenge
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Annalyse Penn plotted revenge for those responsible for destroying her lover Jack von Zarovich – also known as Happy Jack. During her grief, she was guided by a group of demons known as the Quartet. These demons took her to the Lavolion Theater as a venue to stage her revenge. She joined the theater as a dancer, then slowly let the Quartet demons manipulate the place, eventually twisting the world into creating a dark reflection of the Lavolion that lurked in a parallel Abyssal plane beneath the theater. When Annalyse and their demented planar theater were ready, the Quartet advertised a show: Revenge, a Tragedy in Two Acts, by Annalyse Penn. People came to see the show, then never returned home.

The Quartet tore a hole in the Material plane, creating an exact copy of the Lavolion. The duplicate Lavolion emerged during the most recent show at the opera house, and the Quartet trapped the patrons in this nightmare playground world based on Annalyse’s grief. Annalyse is trapped as well, the Quartet having used her to the point where they consider her a discarded, broken toy.

Though Annalyse’s Revenge is a follow up adventure to Happy Jack’s Funhouse, and has ties to The Madhouse of Tasha’s Kiss, you do not have to have run those adventures to run Annalyse’s Revenge. The adventure includes options to run it as a standalone one-shot. Playtime is roughly 3 to 5 hours.

boardgame.name: Freak Show Collection
boardgame.description:
User summary:

This item collects materials previously published as:

The Madhouse of Tasha's Kiss
Happy Jack's Funhouse
Annalyse's Revenge


In addition to new material.

boardgame.name: U³ ConEx Role-Playing Game: Controlled Experiments
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Welcome to Prison...

You are a super-villain who has been caught doing bad things. While in jail, the Warden of the prison offers you a deal. If you go on missions doing good deeds, your time in prison is better than most. If you fail, go off mission, or just make the Warden angry, you get thrown into the deepest cell the prison has to offer. You said yes. You are now part of the Warden's controlled experiment. Welcome to ConEx.

boardgame.name: U³ Fantasy Role-Playing Game
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Welcome to Alphatiev, a world where elves and dragons live in the land. A world where magical airships fly across the skies from great empires. A world where darkness was once vanquished… and now threatens to creep back in through the shadows between peaceful peoples. This is a world of heroes, monsters, and stories. And it is your world to explore and make your own. Welcome to a world of Fantasy.

U3 Fantasy is a complete role-playing game for you to download, read, print (if you want to) and play. Using a rules-lite game engine, you and up to 4 of your friends can immerse yourself in the world heroes going on quests against evil forces that threaten the land.

boardgame.name: Demon Slayer - Kimetsu no Yaiba Jump
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

In the beginning of the Taisho Era in Japan it has been more than forty years since the Meiji revolution, more than thirty since it was made illegal by government edict to carry a sword, and the traditional ways of life in the Land of the Rising Sun have faded and many have been set aside in favor of increasing industrialization and westernization. You are as likely to see a man in a suit coat as you are to see one wearing kimono if you go into the city. As tradition fades, so too do ancient superstitions. So when a village elder tells you stories of man-eating demons that wander the night lusting after the flesh of the unwary and implores you not to go out after the sun has set you smile indulgently and agree, but you do not believe them. There is no such thing as demons you say in your heart, and you set out into the dark.

boardgame.name: Kimetsu no Yaiba: Demon Slayer
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

In an alternate-reality Feudal Japan, a man trying to escape death undergoes a medical procedure which wildly alters his physiology, making him nearly immortal while robbing his humanity.

boardgame.name: LoZ xianxia worldbuilding project
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Throughout the multiverse exists an absolutely countless number of species and existences, arising from natural forces, the clashing of metaphysical energies, Heavenly Laws guiding evolution, and more. The higher up amongst the Realms one goes, the stranger and more primal the species become-devolving to pure and primal Elementals, Spirits, and Automata whose sheer density of power can rival Deities. In the Mortal Realm however, the vast majority of species tend to be Complete existences-possessing the elements of Mind, Body, and Soul. These Complete existences serve as the foundation and population of the entire multiverse, spread out amongst the countless universes in one form or another.

boardgame.name: Slay the Spire: Downfall
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The Spire is a massive pillar, rising from endless wastes, serving as home to an intricate ecosystem of cruelty. From the slimes, beasts, and exiled thugs of the Exordium, to the guardians, knights, and slavers that fester within the City, to the writhing masses, creatures of darkness, and transient horrors that stalk the Beyond, this is no place for the weak.

Enter Neow, an ancient whale seeking to bring this place to its end. She empowers adventurers to sally forth, climbing through fifty floors of malice, and at the end of their journey lies the malevolent Heart that beats within the uppermost chambers. The core of the Spire itself.

But the Heart will not fall without a fight. Rallying its own champions from throughout its depths, it gathers fearsome spirits, automata, gremlins, and more to stop the adventurers in their tracks.

In another version of things, you might be one of those adventurers, seeking to cleanse the evil that dwells within. But this time? This time, you’re gonna be the villain.

boardgame.name: Blood Tide: Black Sails and Dark Rituals: Tales from Dead Men
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The Island of Castonegro is part of a chain of uncharted islands called the Devil’s Hammer. Many pirates escape to this island when evading the Spanish fleet because it has a hidden cove, called the Bed of the Black Cat. This is where pirates can rest and resupply their ships for future conquests. A pirate’s haven of sorts, but it comes with a price. Every now and then there are tales of ships that stray from the normal safe sea lanes within the island chain and encounter things worse than the Spanish fleet. Those ships are never seen again. But then how can those tales be true if there are never any survivors and, as we know, dead men tell no tales.

User summary:

See also Blood Tide: Black Sails and Dark Rituals

boardgame.name: Épico RPG
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

O Épico RPG usa um sistema original brasileiro para jogos de interpretação em qualquer cenário que a imaginação conceber.

Este sistema nasceu com objetivos muito ousados que acabaram se tornando uma lista de suas virtudes.

boardgame.name: NASA Home & City Tech Connect Card Game
boardgame.description:
The Tech Connect Card Game is an educational game to teach the concepts of the NASA Home and City website (homeandcity.nasa.gov), namely that there are many technologies that NASA developed that help in many parts of society. It was distributed for free at various events hosted by NASA.

The game is a deck of cards in shrinkwrap and with a cardboard stiffener. Besides the cover and rules cards, there are 12 Target Cards for aspects of life in Home and City (Bedroom, Bathroom, Living Room, Kitchen, Outside; Air Travel, Automotive, Coastal, Grocery, Manufacturing, Medical, Sports), and 48 Tech Cards about various technologies derived from NASA R&D (e.g. UV-blocking glasses, freeze-dried technology, digital cameras, countertop gardens, self-driving farm vehicles), each with a couple of paragraphs of description.

Players take turns being the judge. The judge reveals the top of the Target Card deck. Each other player chooses one of the six Tech Cards in their hand which they think best impacts the revealed target area. The judge chooses which is the best fit; players can try to persuade the judge why their choice is best. The player whose Tech Card the judge chooses keeps the Target Card, players draw to replace the Tech Cards played, and the next player is the judge for the next round. The player with the most Target Cards after they are all distributed is the winner.

boardgame.name: MathemaChickens
boardgame.description:
Acting as an omnivorous chicken that eats almost anything, gobble up the most food points to win.

MathemaChickens is a simple math game where kids use their equation-making skills to eat their way around the farmyard while avoiding the coyote.

How many answers can be formed from two die numbers? 20: 1-10,12,15,16,18,20,24,25,30,36.

Game play is simultaneous, with each player taking turns to roll the dice then making a move.
On each turn …
1. The current player rolls the dice.
2. Moves the coyote.
3. Players examine the numbers rolled and think of two or more equations using those numbers. (Add, substract, multiply, divide)
4. The rolling player makes the first move, following by the remaining player(s) clockwise.

boardgame.name: I GDR e la Dichiarazione d'Intenti
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:
There is a wide variety of events that can spoil a gaming night or even a long-standing campaign: growing frustrations, unrecognized interests, unfulfilled expectations, misunderstood requests, mismatched tones, forgotten promises… the list goes on for ages. However, as incredible as it may seem most of these things actually begin before you even sit at the table for the first time. It’s bad when you can’t see it, but if you are ready to give the Declaration of Intent a spin, you will find that you don’t need to.
boardgame.rpgitemversion: I GDR e la Dichiarazione d'Intenti PDF
I GDR e la Dichiarazione d'Intenti print
RPGs and the Declaration of Intents PDF

boardgame.name: Zero Level Rulebook
boardgame.description: A set of rules for adventuring as commoners for 5e Dungeons & Dragons.

boardgame.name: Botanik: First Player Metal Token
boardgame.description:
Piece of collection edited by Space cowboys
given at Essen 2021

boardgame.name: Ankh'or: First Player Metal Token
boardgame.description:
Piece of collection
Distributed at Essen 2021

boardgame.name: The Brittany war of independence
La guerre d'indépendance de Bretagne (1487-1491)
Le Lys & L'Hermine
boardgame.description:
The Brittany War of Independence 1487-91 simulates the conflict between the Kingdom of France and the Duchy of Brittany. The war ended with the defeat of the Britons and the marriage of the Duchess Anne to the King of France Charles VIII, sealing the annexation of the Duchy to the kingdom. This game is part of the Gold and Steel series which allows the campaigns of the late 15th and early 16th centuries to be played on a strategic and tactical scale. A combatant counter represents respectively 1,500 to 2,000 pedestrians and 750 to 1,000 riders on the front and half on the back. One artillery counter represents a hundred guns - of all types and calibers.

The game is played over 13 turns corresponding to a season (spring, summer, autumn), the winter turn is not played.
The game puts the French camp in opposition to the Breton camp between which the great Breton lords evolve between betrayal and loyalty; Laval, Rieux Rohan.
This is both a strategic & tactical game with armies and garrisons evolving on the main strategic map. All fighters of this period, such as knights, mercenaries (English bowmen, Gascon crossbowmen, German lansquenets and Swiss pikes), bowmen, billmen, pikes, early arquebusier, country militia, etc., fight on a tactical map featuring a typical XVth century battleground The ambience of that period is added with tactical chits played during the combat rounds (cannon battery, charge, cut and thrust, dismounted knights, ditch, fence, harassment shots, raining arrows) and events such as rain, no fight or betrayal, no wing deployment.
The complete sequence of a turn:
I/ Kingdom of France
1) Reinforcement, replacement
2) strategic move
3) attrition phase
4) combat phase (battles & sieges)
II/ Duchy of Brittany
Same sequence
III/ Diplomatic phase
Check for victory


5 of the Gold & Steel series

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

listing.notes: FRENCH VERSION, English rules available for download via: https://www.vaevictismag.fr/en/content/9-english-rules

boardgame.name: I.Q. 2000 Trans Canada Trivia
boardgame.description:
This Canadian spin-off of the I.Q. 2000 game, published some time in the mid-1980s, has you navigate across Canada rather than the solar system. It comes with 800 cards (200 per category - History/Geography, Famous People, General Knowledge for Adults, and General Knowledge for Children), each with 5 questions on it, for a total of 4000 trivia questions about Canada and Canadians. It also includes a gameboard with the Canadian map, 6 player pieces (which are stackable if two players land on the same space), 1 die, a plastic storage tray, and instructions.

The object of the game is to be the first player to correctly answer a trivia question after reaching the last circle on the gameboard (in Victoria, British Columbia, Canada). Players take turns rolling the die to move. The color of the space they land on determines which category of question should be asked to them by the player to their right. When children are playing, they can be asked questions only from the easier children's category regardless of which color of space they land on. As long as a player continues answering questions correctly, they get to keep taking more turns. When they get a question wrong, then the player to their left gets a turn. When someone reaches the final space in Victoria, they must answer a final question correctly to win; otherwise, they must move 4 spaces backwards and wait for another turn to try again.

The publisher considers certain topics "integral to the educational aspects of the game", so there is some overlap between the adults' and children's questions, just with different phrasing.

boardgame.name: The Dentist
boardgame.description:
Do you want to become a dentist and run your own dental clinic? Then, this is your very special game, whether you’re a student or actually a… real dentist. Equip the clinic, hire the best team you can have and let the fun begin.

The Dentist Game, an ideal way to spend your free time and socialize with your friends while you learn new things about dentistry in a more easy and enjoying way. At the very beginning of the game, you have to choose the level of the location interior and waiting room as well as your team of technicians, assistants, students and the starting tools, consumables. After you have put in place all those aspects, you start to upgrade your estates, until you reach the maximum level of 3 for each part of them.

Your managing and economical skills are used to a full extension in this “venue”, so you have all the tools in order to not worry that you have lost your time by the time you get to $10000 (For Your Information: You start with $2000 in your bankroll and the winner is decided by that one person who manages to get to the $10k mark). Time management is also a key factor in this game, so you have to be careful with your game plan, because times means money, right?

Minimum number of required players for the game to be played in a proper way: 2.

Durability of a game that involves at least 4 players: 30 minutes to 1 hour of play-time.

boardgame.name: A Gathering of Witches
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Gathering of Witches is a Fifth Edition adventure for 3 to 7 characters, optimized for a party of 5 characters of 3rd level.

The characters learn about a student cohort that’s planning to hold a summoning circle in the dead of night at the library. Some of the other students are worried that the magic is too dangerous, but are too afraid to confront the cohort directly. Will the characters rise to the occasion to protect their fellow students from themselves?

BACKGROUND
The school library is home to ancient magic and knowledge. Throughout the centuries it has served many scholars with its information, but a select few are aware of its more occult offerings. Beneath the central dias is a secret chamber that houses large fragments of an otherworldly crystal. The crystal is a powerful conduit of magic, allowing those that know how to use it to cast magic well beyond their individual capacity.

A knowledge-hungry merfolk student named Anemone learned about the hidden chamber from Omh’odhri, the aberrant dean of conjuration, due to a clumsy slip of the tongue. It took a few months, but eventually Anemone figured out how to open the secret chamber. Unable to let the information go unused, she’s roped her cohort into helping her perform a magic ritual in the secret chamber of the library.

boardgame.name: Honey, the Rats in the Basement Unionized
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Honey, The Rats in the Basement Unionized is a Fifth Edition adventure for 3 to 7 characters, optimized for a party of 4 characters of 1st or 2nd level. Rats in the undercroft have been magically awakened by improper disposal of botched potions and have declared sovereignty. The characters are called to exterminate the rats. Will they do the dirty work or make new friends?

This adventure is intended to be run as part of the Rafiton: Arcane School for Monsters adventure path. However, this adventure can be run as a one-shot in any semi-urban setting. The adventure location is a rocky cave situated beneath a potions classroom, shop, or similar building.

Background
Franklin, a monstrous giant snail and a professor of potion-making, has been indiscriminately disposing of potions, which have been draining into the local water supply. An unforeseen byproduct of this was the incidental awakening of giant rats that were drinking from the tainted water supply. The awakened rats have taken over the undercroft where Franklin stores his treasure and old supplies for potion-making.

boardgame.name: The Iron Maiden
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Iron Maiden is a Fifth Edition adventure for 3 to 7 characters, optimized for a party of 4 characters of 1st or 2nd level.

Opal, a sentient iron golem, wants to learn more about their creator, a reclusive wizard that came to Eth Aldur from the outskirts of the city before allegedly forfeiting their life to create them. They want the characters to join them on an expedition to find and investigate where their creator came from.

BACKGROUND
Hidden in plain sight along one of the roads of the underearth, the dwarven scholar Tydur Brightreach set up a facility for the research, construction, and testing of golems. Tydur was especially interested in the prospect of creating autonomous, sentient life. After decades of research and failed attempts, they managed to create Opal, a sentient iron golem. When they concluded that Opal was a success in a controlled environment, they used magic to suppress their memories and set them loose near Eth Aldur to see what would happen in a live environment. Much to Tydur’s delight, Opal was able to successfully integrate with the dwarven society there. Since the success of Opal, Tydur has been obsessed with replicating his results and is currently consumed with developing a successor.

Meanwhile, Opal has been living in Eth Aldur for decades now. Using her strength and resilience to heat to her advantage, she quickly became an indispensable asset at the dwarven forges. Over time, the magic that Tydur used to suppress her memories began to erode. Through fragments of memory and the resources of Eth Aldur, Opal was able to pin-point the likely location of Tydur and her origin.

boardgame.name: The Barista
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The barista grinds coffee and steeps tea leaves, brewing refreshing, bold and delicious drinks for himself, his companions, and anyone around him in need of a pick-me-up. A barista is a warm and welcome member to any adventuring party who can prepare miraculous and invigorating brews.

Made for use with Pathfinder 1st edition and the Spheres of Might system, this new Blacksmith archetype gives a new way to provide benefits for your team. Where the blacksmith and iron chef provide static, reliable buffs to their party, the barista instead offers a more conditional (but often more potent) boost exactly when it is most needed, letting allies reroll crucial checks with scaling bonuses at the cost of a self-stacking debuff that is as customizable as the benefits.

boardgame.name: The Taxonomy of the Assdeer
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Beware adventurers, the mysterious and disturbing Assdeer.
These beasts are sure to cause a stink with your players, and have them..... cracking up.

boardgame.name: Fighter Archetype: Iron Knight
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The fighters who take on the Iron Knight Archetype have harnessed latent powers within to bend metal to their will in battle. These warriors seldom find themselves defenseless and won’t hesitate to use this resilience to stand between their allies and all manner of foe.

Expanding upon the mechanics of the 5E Fighter class, this PDF allows you to create fighters who use magnetism to form temporary armor and even animate weapons and equipment to fight on their behalf.

boardgame.name: Holding Your Own
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

You have fought through the undead guardians of the Amorian Treasury and recovered a vast store of valuables. As you prepare to leave, you hear noises in the defunct structure...

Although set in the Margou Campaign, this adventure setting is easily adaptable to most any game and system. This scenario was created for five, fourth level adventurers.

boardgame.name: Razor Ridge
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Years ago the frontier area near Catar was cleared out by Lord Razor. Recent reports indicate that the humanoids on the mountain are on the move to take back the land stolen from them!

Although set in the Margou Campaign, this adventure setting is easily adaptable to most any game and system. This scenario was created for a group of mid-level (4th level) adventurers.

boardgame.name: Lady Lovibond
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

When a mysterious ships floats into harbor, you and your friends can't resist a little investigation into the strange craft. You'll need to "borrow" a rowboat though...

Although set in the Margou Campaign, this adventure setting is easily adaptable to most any game and system. This scenario was created for a group of first levell adventurers.

boardgame.name: Assault of Carma's Tower
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

While cutting across the frontier you and your group discover a group of Dwarven miners with a problem. A regional enchanter has an army of Flying Apes terrorizing the poor miners who are merely attempting to mine a mountain. They have asked for assistance and an offer of gems or ore is likely!

Although set in the Margou Campaign, this adventure setting is easily adaptable to most any game and system. This scenario was created for a group of fourth level adventurers.

boardgame.name: Cartomancer
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Cards of Power!

The Cartomancer is a brand-new class for DnD 5th Edition, a spellcaster dabbling in every magical tradition as they draw power from a card deck that is equal parts weapon and magical focus. Mystical gamblers and masters of chance, cartomancers use their cards as tools for weaving spells with decks that may focus on divination, illusion, and mental manipulation, elements and flora and fauna with a primal deck, raw power of life and death with a divine deck, or the diverse and balanced options of an arcane deck. You’ll also find a complete system of Card Casting, with unique card spells like arcane erosion, untouchable ward, and bend nature for every card in a standard deck that you can heighten and empower by varying the number of cards you devote to their power from your mystic hand.

boardgame.name: Bear Trap: The Soviet-Afghan War, 1979-1989
boardgame.description:
Bear Trap: The Soviet-Afghan War is a quick-playing, low-complexity game simulating the Soviet-Afghan War (1979-1989). Bear Trap adapts the game system from Sekigahara to this new setting.

One player takes command of the ruling Democratic Republic of Afghanistan and its forces, supported by the Soviet 40th Army. The other player takes command of the local tribal rebels (the Lashkar) and Mujahideen guerrilla fighters. The Soviet player seeks to prop up the sympathetic local government and “solve the Russian Ice-lock Problem” while the Insurgent player seeks to expel the foreign invaders and secularist government.

Gameplay consists of alternating turns playing cards to replenish, activate, and move units on an area-based map of Afghanistan, with battles occurring whenever units from both sides end up in the same space. Bear Trap adapts the core mechanics from GMT Games' classic Sekigahara, allowing for the possibility of betrayal and defections, but also adds several new aspects, such as hidden unit stances, powerful strategy cards, and a unique card-assisted solo mode for either side.

Bear Trap is first and foremost a 2-player game, but it also includes rules for solo play (which utilizes a card-assisted flowchart bot).

Time Scale: 16-20 months per Reshuffle
Unit Scale: 1 Block = 500 - 8,000 soldiers
Number of Players: 1 to 2
Play Time: 2 to 3 hours
Complexity: Low (3/9 on GMT's scale)

boardgame.name: 1985: Sacred Oil
boardgame.description:
“Iran active intervention into the sphere of relations between the Soviet Union and other socialist countries, its reiterated attempts to incite unrest in the Caucasian regions, its fanatical refusal to put an end to the prolonged conflict with Iraq, leave the Union of the Soviet Socialist Republics no other choice than the use of military force.”

Public Declaration of State Committee on the State of Emergency in the U.S.S.R.
Moscow June 28, 1985


"1985: Sacred Oil" covers the Soviet offensive in the Persian Gulf area, today recognized as the prelude to World War Three. Initially limited to Soviet Union, Iran and Iraq, the conflict quickly extended to other Arab countries, US and finally NATO and Warsaw Pact.

The complex Middle East political situation, the logistic problems and the distances involved are only some of the challenges both sides must face. Soviet Union must avoid an early full mobilization of the West, while United States and its allies must interpret Kremlin's real intents and react in an appropriate manner.

As in the other 1985 modules, every aspect of a modern conflict is covered in detail. Sacred Oil raises the stake by having no fixed Order Of Battle and a field of action encompassing the whole globe.



Game Components


6 Operational Maps, covering Southwest Asia from USSR Caucasian Republics to Oman and from Baghdad to the Strait of Hormuz.
1 Strategic Map, covering the whole globe.
80 Event Cards, used for mobilizing forces, diplomatic actions and special operations.
2000+ counters, representing US, USSR, UK, France, Iran, Iraq and other countries forces.
44 pages Rules Booklet
40 pages Scenarios Booklet
10 pages Field Manual with operational examples
2 Tables booklets
8 Player’s Aid Charts
2 20-Sided Dice




Game Highlights


Order of Battle and TO&E are not “generic”, but set exactly in June, 1985
No predetermined OOB: everything depends by the political and strategic decisions taken by both sides
14km per hex, 48 hours per game turn
Division / Brigade / Battalion sized ground combat units
Special Forces, Airmobile, Paratroops, Electronic Warfare, Artillery, SSM, SAM and Air Defense Artillery units
Squadron sized Air and Helicopter units
Extensive air war rules covering Escort, Intercept, SEAD, Wild Weasel, Ground Strike and more
Surface Ships and Submarines, from single flag ships to groups of fast patrol missile boats
Realistic but flowing naval rules. Everyone here remembers the horror of TNW’s 12-turns naval phase
Specific operational tactics like Single-Echelon Assault and Active Defense
Tension period, where both sides mobilize their forces and try to gain allies in the region
Six different scenarios of increasing complexity:
And It Became Blood: USS CV-63 Kitty Hawk operations to shut down Soviet bases in Ethiopia and South Yemen
Behold a Great Red Dragon: The initial Soviet offensive in Northern Iran
And the Sea Gave Up the Dead: Soviet and US Forces clash for the control of Bandar Abbas
The Whore of Babylon: The July 1985 Iraqi offensive, taking advantage of a collapsing Iranian army
Gog and Magog: The full Persian Gulf campaign, from the initial growing tension to the final global conflict
To Shatter the Old World: Under an Iron Sky + Deadly Northern Lights + Sacred Oil combined campaign. Nothing can be worse.

Playable stand-alone or in combination with 1985:Under an Iron Sky and 1985: Deadly Northern Lights.
